com.metreeca.gate.wrappers

Class Manager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.metreeca.gate.wrappers.Manager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Wrapper

    public final class Manager
extends Object
implements Wrapper
    Session manager.

    Manages user authentication/authorization and session lifecycle using permits issued by shared roster tool.

    Provides a virtual session management handler at the provided path with the methods described below.

    Warning / Make sure XSS/XSRF protection is active when using session managers.

    Session Retrieval

     GET <path>
 Cookie: ID=<token> // optional

    Between session creation and deletion, any requests to the virtual session management handler will automatically include the session token in a cookie header, enabling user authentication.

    Active session / The current session is reported with a response including a session token in a HTTP only session cookie, the session expiry date in milliseconds in the custom timeout directive of the Cache-Control header and a JSON payload containing the user profile included in the permit returned by the user roster.

     200 OK
 Set-Cooke: ID=<token>; Path=<base>; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=Lax
 Cache-Control: no-store, timeout=1560940206395
 Content-Type: application/json

 {
     …    // user profile
 }

    No active session / The anonymous session is reported with a response including an empty session token in a HTTP only self-expiring session cookie, a dummy session expiry date in milliseconds in the custom timeout directive of the Cache-Control header and an empty JSON payload; malformed, invalid or expired session tokens are ignored.

     200 OK
 Set-Cooke: ID=; Path=<base>; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=Lax; Max-Age=0
 Cache-Control: no-store, timeout=0
 Content-Type: application/json

 {}

    Session Creation

     POST <path>
 Content-Type: application/json

 {
     "handle": "<handle>",            // user handle, e.g. an email address
     "secret": "<current password>",  // current user password
     "update": "<new password>"       // new user password (optional)
 }

    Successful credentials validation / A session is created and reported with a response including a session token in a HTTP only session cookie, the session expiry date in milliseconds in the custom timeout directive of the Cache-Control header and a JSON payload containing the user profile included in the permit returned by the user roster.

     200 OK
 Set-Cooke: ID=<token>; Path=<base>; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=Lax
 Cache-Control: no-store, timeout=1560940206395
 Content-Type: application/json

 {
     …    // user profile
 }

    Failed credentials validation / Reported with a response providing a machine-readable error code among those defined by Roster.

     403 Forbidden
 Content-Type: application/json

 {
      "error": "<error>"
 }

    Malformed session ticket / Reported with a response providing a machine-readable error code.

     400 Bad Request
 Content-Type: application/json

 {
      "error": "ticket-malformed"
 }

    Session Deletion

     POST <path>
 Cookie: ID=<token> // optional
 Content-Type: application/json

 {}

    Successful session deletion / The current session is delete and reported with a response including an empty session token in a HTTP only self-expiring session cookie, a dummy session expiry date in milliseconds in the custom timeout directive of the Cache-Control header and an empty JSON payload; malformed, invalid and expired session tokens are ignored.

     200 OK
 Set-Cooke: ID=; Path=<base>; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=Lax; Max-Age=0
 Cache-Control: no-store, timeout=0
 Content-Type: application/json

 {}

    Secured Resource Access

    Between session creation and deletion, any requests to restricted REST endpoints will automatically include the session token in a cookie header, enabling user authentication and authorization.

     <METHOD> <resource>
 Cookie: ID=<token> // optional

 …

    Successful token validation / The response includes the response generated by the secured handler; a new session cookie may be included if the session was automatically extended.

     <###> <Status>
 Set-Cooke: ID=<token>; Path=<base>; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=Lax // optional

 …

    Failed token validation / Due either to session deletion or expiration or to a modified user opaque handle; no details about the failure are disclosed.

     401 Unauthorized
 WWW-Authenticate: …
 Content-Type: application/json

 {}
    See Also:
    RFC 7234 Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Caching - 5.2.3. Cache Control Extensions

    • Constructor Detail

      • Manager

        public Manager(String path,
               long soft,
               long hard)
        Creates a session manager.
        Parameters:
        path - the root relative path of the virtual session handler
        soft - the soft session timeout in milliseconds; on soft timeout session are automatically deleted if no activity was registered in the given period
        hard - the hard session timeout in milliseconds; on hard timeout session are unconditionally deleted
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if path is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if path is not root relative or either idle or hard is less than or equal to 0 or idle is greater than hard

    • Method Detail

      • wrap

        Description copied from interface: Wrapper
        Wraps a handler.
        Specified by:
        wrap in interface Wrapper
        Parameters:
        handler - the handler to be wrapped
        Returns:
        the combined handler generated by wrapping this wrapper around handler
